# Summary
The Council of State and Territorial Epidemiologist Early Career Professionals Subcommittee hosted a series of webinars on software utilized in applied epidemiology. The January showcase focused on how various public health practioners around the country utilize R to fulfill many of their data needs. I persented on a panel along with other public health professionals and provided examples of how our team uses R to collect, analyze, and report birth defect data to stakeholders and the public.

# Title
Reimagining your Data with R	Early Career Professionals	01/13/2023
Speakers: Michael Samuel, DrPH - US Virgin Islands Data Science Training Team - **Christopher Barnett, MS MPH** - Neil Goldstein, PhD MBI

# Objectives:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/R_logo.svg/1200px-R_logo.svg.png)
By the end of this webinar, participants will be able to:
- Identify the purpose and application of R software packages.
- Describe the application of R to create public health dashboards.
- Describe how to use R for complex modeling and associated visualizations.
- Discuss the experience of transitioning to R as a new learner.
- Describe current opportunities and resources for professional development with R software packages.
